Congratulations to Kevin Stinehart, our 2020 Teacher of the Year!
Kevin is a 4th grade science and social studies teacher at Central Academy of the Arts. During the past two years, he has dedicated himself to making the school's arts-integration theme a reality. In addition to his work in the classroom, he established two extracurricular clubs last year to give students' creativity an opportunity to flourish!
This year, Pickens Federal Credit Union sponsored a prize of $1,500 for our Teacher of the Year. We're very grateful for the business community's support of our schools!

Due to storm damage and flooding, Pickens County schools will be closed on Friday, February 7, 2020.

Students will make up the day by participating in a Digital Learning Day.

Digital Learning Days allow students to make up days missed to inclement weather or other emergencies by completing a set of assignments within 5 days. For students in grades 4-12, most or all of these assignments can be completed on the student's school-issued Chomebook. In Pre-K through 3rd grade, teachers will give students a folder of assignments to complete (if folders were not sent home on Thursday, they will be given to students on Monday, and assignments will be due on Feb. 18). Your child's teacher will communicate the details of the assignments for your child's class. Students who do not complete their assignments will be counted as absent for the day.
